item.title: U.S. oil benchmark falls back below $70 a barrel on China stimulus disappointment
item.description: Oil futures picked up Monday where they left off at the end of last week, under pressure following disappointment out of news from China, the world‚Äôs largest crude importer, and expectations for higher U.S. production once President-election Donald Trump takes office.

item.title: GM's Wall Street vindication is happening as it outperforms its peers in 2024
item.description: GM is proving it's a standout among automakers this year as it continues to consistently outperforms Wall Street's earnings expectations and its competitors.

item.title: Dow jumps 300 points, poised for first close above 44,000 as Trump enthusiasm continues: Live updates
item.description: Bank stocks largely boosted the Dow, as investors hope the sector could see weaker regulation in a second Trump administration.

item.title: FTX sues crypto exchange Binance and its former CEO Zhao for $1.8 billion
item.description: The litigation marks the latest escalation of tensions between two of the biggest names in crypto, after the meteoric collapse of FTX rocked the market.

item.title: Bitcoin tops $83,000 as crypto euphoria over Trump win shows no sign of waning
item.description: Bitcoin hit another high Monday, as the rally in cryptocurrencies continued following President-elect Donald Trump's election win.

item.title: Jack Dorsey dramatically scales back crypto ambitions for Block
item.description: Block said Thursday that it was "winding down" its TBD division, which had sought to create an open-source crypto development platform.

item.title: Painting the town pink and green: 'Wicked' takes over retail ahead of theatrical debut
item.description: Universal's "Wicked" is drumming up buzz ahead of its Nov. 22 release with hundreds of merchandise offerings from dozens of retail partners.
